Here is a collection of projects from a six-week course I took on programming in the summer of 2021, which was also my first time using R!

## [Building a project website](https://xochitlmedina.github.io/xochitlmedina/)

- In this assignment I created a GitHub user site
- I gained an understanding of Rmarkdown syntax
- I learned how to format a website

## ["Data Wrangling" - An Analysis of The Covid-19 Pandemic](https://xochitlmedina.github.io/geog-13-labs/geog-13-labs/docs/lab-o2.html)

- Gained a strong understanding of the functions of the dplyr package
- Made plots that suited the data at hand
- Found the 7-day rolling mean of data that represented daily events

## ["Projections, Distancing, and Mapping" - An Analysis of US Borders](https://xochitlmedina.github.io/geog-13-labs//lab-03.html)

- Gained a strong understanding of the functions of the SF package
- Changed the projections of spatial data within RStudio 
- Plotted spatial data using varying line weights, colors, and sizes

## ["Tesselations, Spatial Joins, and Point-in-Polygon" - An Analysis Dams and Tessellations](https://xochitlmedina.github.io/geog-13-labs//lab-04.html)

- Learned what a tessellation is
- Learned the difference between different tessellations and coverages
- Modified aforementioned tessellations
